thread.title: Jackets land in Bradley’s not-so-early Top 25
thread.title_full: Jackets land in Bradley’s not-so-early Top 25

author: The Atlanta Journal-Constitution 9:35 a.m. Friday, Feb. 24, 2017 Sports 0 Sports View Caption Hide Caption Hyosub Shin/hshin@ajc.com Despite the loss of quarterback Justin Thomas, Georgia Tech will still rank among the top teams in the country next season, says Mark Bradley. Despite the loss of quarterback Justin Thomas -- the best QB in Paul Johnson’s nine seasons at Georgia Tech according to Mark Bradley -- the Jackets have landed in the not-so-early Top 25 rankings for the 2017 season. Says Bradley: ‘I know they have tricky early games against Tennessee and Central Florida .... I know they go to Miami and Clemson.’ Through it all, he believes, the Jackets will still find a way to get it done. Added Bradley: “When Johnson says, “Nobody had us ranked,” I want to be able to say, “There’s one guy who did.” Read the complete Top 25 here. Related Paul Johnson unloads on ACC for ‘ridiculous’ schedule
title: Jackets land in Bradley’s not-so-early Top 25
text:
Despite the loss of quarterback Justin Thomas -- the best QB in Paul Johnson’s nine seasons at Georgia Tech according to Mark Bradley -- the Jackets have landed in the not-so-early Top 25 rankings for the 2017 season.
Says Bradley: ‘I know they have tricky early games against Tennessee and Central Florida .... I know they go to Miami and Clemson.’ Through it all, he believes, the Jackets will still find a way to get it done.
Added Bradley: “When Johnson says, “Nobody had us ranked,” I want to be able to say, “There’s one guy who did.”
Read the complete Top 25 here.
